sn22.155:4.2: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does identity view arise?”
sn22.155:4.3: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn22.155:4.4: “When form exists, because of grasping form and insisting on form, identity view arises.
sn22.155:4.8: consciousness exists, because of grasping consciousness and insisting on consciousness, identity view arises.
sn22.155:4.9: What do you think, mendicants? Is form permanent or impermanent?”
sn22.155:4.12: “But without grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would identity view arise?”
sn22.155:4.20: “But without grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would identity view arise?”
sn22.155:4.23: They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’”
